metadata.name: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\wmiprvse.exe')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')))

output.summary: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

metadata.objective: False positives: 1. AppvClient 2. CCM 3. WinRM Reference: https://any.run/report/68bc255f9b0db6a0d30a8f2dadfbee3256acfe12497bf93943bc1eab0735e45e/a2385d6f-34f7-403c-90d3-b1f9d2a90a5e
